meanings.definition: A member of a people of southern Russia and Ukraine, noted for their horsemanship and military skill.
meanings.sent1: The cossack rode his horse with great skill.
meanings.sent2: The cossack tribe was known for their excellent military abilities.
meanings.sent3: The cossack tried to juggle swords on horseback, but it didn't end well.
meanings.sent4: She was a cossack in battle, fearless and swift like the wind.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cossack warrior on horseback was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A member of a paramilitary group in Russia and Ukraine, typically characterized by their distinctive dress and traditions.
meanings.sent1: The cossack in the parade wore a traditional uniform.
meanings.sent2: The cossack group gathered to practice their drills.
meanings.sent3: The cossack accidentally put on his uniform backward and marched in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like a cossack among civilians.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the cossack attire caught everyone's attention.
